sentences.en: A survey reflects business scepticism about the strength of the economic recovery.
sentences.cn: 一份调查反映出商业界对经济恢复能力的怀疑。

sentences.en: By contrast, modern scepticism challenges nobody and dismantles only theories of change.
sentences.cn: 相反, 现代的怀疑主义却并不质疑任何人,仅仅摧毁变革理论.

sentences.en: Despite scepticism, founder Trent Huang was no - nonsensical and confident about his company.
sentences.cn: 不过, 创办人黄川在介绍“咿呀.com” 的时候,却满是严肃和自信.

sentences.en: He curled his upper lip in a show of scepticism.
I was so hurt by her coldness and scepticism that tears rose to my eyes.
sentences.cn: 她的冷淡和怀疑深深地伤了我的心,我的泪水都涌到眼眶里来了.

sentences.en: Mark was well aware of the scepticism which he continually provoked.
sentences.cn: 马克对自己不断引起的怀疑主义十分清楚.

sentences.en: Scepticism and trust are not necessarily incompatible.
sentences.cn: 怀疑与信任未必不能共存.

sentences.en: Scepticism remains on whether Malaysia can follow through on its promises.
sentences.cn: 仍有人怀疑马来西亚能否将承诺坚持到底.

sentences.en: Such claims should be regarded with a certain amount of scepticism.
sentences.cn: 对这样的说法，大可不必全信。

sentences.en: The hype and fervour surrounding the event positively invited scepticism.
sentences.cn: 围绕这件事的大肆渲染和热情必然会引起人们的怀疑.

sentences.en: The report has inevitably been greeted with scepticism.
sentences.cn: 那份报告不可避免地受到了质疑。

sentences.en: There is more scepticism, for example, that family reunification benefits host countries.
sentences.cn: 而更多的则是质疑, 例如, 家人团聚是否可以惠及居住国.

sentences.en: There was considerable scepticism about the Chancellor's forecast of a booming economy.
sentences.cn: 有相当多的人对财政大臣作出的经济会迅猛发展的预测表示怀疑。

sentences.en: This theory was initially received with great scepticism by her fellow scientists.
sentences.cn: 她的科学界同行最初对这一理论持有强烈的怀疑态度.

sentences.en: We must not allow our necessary scepticism to degenerate into cynicism.
sentences.cn: 我们不应让必要的怀疑态度滑向玩世不恭.

sentences.en: Wherever it flourished an undercurrent of scepticism was never far away.
sentences.cn: 不论它在哪里盛行,潜在的怀疑倾向总是萦绕左右.

words.tran_cn: 怀疑的；怀疑论的；习惯怀疑的
怀疑论者；疑虑极深的人

trans.tran_cn: 怀疑态度，怀疑论，怀疑主义，怀疑宗教（教条），=skepticism
trans.tran_en: an attitude of doubting that particular claims or statements are true or that something will happen
